title: (Almost) Everything about Rollup
body:
msfew@Foresight Ventures

This post focuses on the Layer2 Rollup universe of Ethereum (only including Secured Rollup), and will explore the good and bad of the current Rollups from the core concepts and mechanism design in an easy-to-understand way, and think about the potential routes and advantages and disadvantages of each of their future solutions in terms of decentralization, further scaling, composability, and additional features such as privacy.

A Secured Rollup is a Rollup model like Arbitrum or Optimism, where settlement, consensus, and data availability all rely on L1s like Ethereum, and only handle the execution itself.

**If a Rollup uses a scheme other than L1 for settlement, consensus, or data availability, then it is not a pure Secured Rollup, and it is not in our narrow definition of Rollup.**

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*xxVXlRpqK2T8BJ_a-SPc3w.jpeg)

## 0. Essence and Principle of Rollup

## a) Essence of Rollup

**There are two ways to scale a blockchain: one is to optimize the blockchain itself, and the other is to use the blockchain in a better way.**

Rollup is the second type, and its real essence is simple: faster, cheaper and “trusted” use of the blockchain, to scale the blockchain (basically referring to Ethereum in particular).

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*17dQq7NAb2MtZcDNP_oLMg.png)

**Rollup is: an on-chain smart contract + an off-chain aggregator.**

It’s as simple as that. The combination of these two features defines Rollup and fleshes out its concept.

* **On-chain smart contract**, which means that its [trust model](https://mirror.xyz/0xaFaBa30769374EA0F971300dE79c62Bf94B464d5/k8Fr68ELdjIwJpGPpag_dnUarnypD5IUahpp6wT0qmk) is a smart contract on Ethereum, that [borrows the security of Ethereum](https://twitter.com/bkiepuszewski/status/1532617975433502721?s=21&t=QYKPEaEdbn-_cSS6N4vcXQ), rather than requiring a new trust consensus like other Alt L1. We can trust Arbitrum’s protocol in the same way that we trust Uniswap’s protocol (which is a smart contract at its core).
* **Off-chain aggregator**, which means it will execute and aggregate transactions off-chain, compressing large volumes of transactions and eventually putting them on the Ethereum mainnet for the purpose of making transactions faster and cheaper.

The mechanism of Ethereum is that each node stores and executes every transaction submitted to it, so such a decentralized network is very expensive.

The mechanism of Optimistic Rollup represented by Aribitrum and Optimism, and the mechanism of zk Rollup represented by zkSync and StarkNet are shown later for the reader to understand briefly.

## b) Mechanism of Optimistic Rollup

**Optimistic Rollup is, as the name suggests, optimistic. It uses a presumption of innocence, where everyone will believe by default that each execution is correct, and security is ensured by the fact that each batch state can be challenged by fraud proof.**

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*NHa5M8YEHW6cBRbLLNt0hQ.png)

Users submit transactions in Arbitrum network, and Arbitrum’s sequencer executes the transactions, submitting the complete state root and transaction data in batches to a smart contract on the Ethereum mainnet.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*wZORk3IYi-EIqG6rJbVPmA.jpeg)

**What if the Optimistic Rollup execution generates errors?**

* **Optimistic Rollup has a dispute validation cycle**, which means that the data will not be finalized until, say, a week after it is uploaded, during which time anyone can challenge it and prove that the batch is incorrect.

## c) Mechanism of zk Rollup

**zk Rollup, as the name implies, uses zk zero-knowledge proof technology (actually Validity Proof). It uses the presumption of guilt, where people will default to questioning that each execution is wrong, and security is ensured by the proofs contained in each batch.**

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*nPIMHkky4szN-ppksPhd3g.png)

Users submit transactions in zkSync, the sequencer of zkSync executes and stores the transactions, and submits the proof of state and the new state in batches to the smart contract on the Ethereum mainnet in full.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*ZzOd2UAb3QXjvk7Dbc5qjA.png)

**How can zk prove that execution is not wrong?**

* **Prover (or sequencer in most cases) generates unforgeable proofs of the execution of transactions, proving that these new states and executions are correct.** Sequencer compresses the proofs and other data and submits them to the smart contracts in the Ethereum mainnet for verification.

**How do they compress data, thereby reducing gas fees?**

* **Rollup can be compressed in terms of the number of bytes per transaction**, including nonce and signature, etc. **For zk Rollup, it can further compress the data that is not relevant to the state update, because zk proofs can already prove the correctness of the state update**, while Optimistic Rollup cannot ignore this data because it needs to be able to be challenged.

**Why do the data uploaded to mainnet need to be in full (for a Secured Rollup)?**

* **Because in order to prevent sequencer escapes**, we can rebuild the entire Layer 2 from data on Ethereum. This relates to the concept of data availability.

## d) Differences of Two Types of Rollups

If you still can’t understand it, you can check the diagram below.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*4V9iUhqLAcqWT6X6lxyZOA.png)

Optimistic Rollup is designed more like Arweave, using economics and game theory to design a mechanism that performs well but is not really guaranteed to be 100% correct.

zk Rollup design is more like Filecoin, which uses cryptography and mathematics to design a mechanism that is guaranteed to be 100% correct but always has additional computational and time overhead.

The difference is that **one uses a challenge period to ensure that errors can be corrected, and the other uses cryptography to ensure that errors cannot occur**.

We will compare them in detail later by their end-game performance.

## 1. Rollup, the Good

Let’s start by taking about what is great about the Rollups as a whole:

* Ecosystem: Arbitrum had the NFT and Metaverse ecosystems; Optimism has issued the token, and had the governance and community; StarkNet has a variety of GameFi innovations in the works; zkSync has a number of new DeFi projects. Each Rollup stands on its own.
* Scaling: Their TPS is indeed excellent, though not as high as the theoretical peak, but the fast confirmation of L2 provides a fast and almost feeless Web3 experience.
* Experience: Switching to Rollup is a simple task for developers and users, and the experience is almost identical to that of Ethereum. Various cross-chain bridges, wallets, Uniswap and other infrastructures also serve for a smooth user experience. This is also supported by a good ecosystem.
* Innovation: Rollup is already an excellent ground for innovation in EVM applications, and is also more imaginative than Polygon’s “test network” style network.

Besides, if you are interested in the comparison between subnets and Rollup, you can refer to [our previous study](https://foresightventures.medium.com/avalanche-from-evm-compatible-l1-to-subnet-practitioner-3ca045407ec6), and [Toghrui’s view](https://twitter.com/toghrulmaharram/status/1531956445490601984).

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*a_tuxKtRIOxrsbWk8WdU-Q.jpeg)

In more detail, the performance of the major Optimistic Rollups and zk Rollups are [given](https://www.alexbeckett.xyz/a-snapshot-of-the-current-rollup-ecosystem/) below:

* Arbitrum: TVL is around $2.4 billion. [The Nitro upgrade](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/arbitrum-nitro-sneak-preview-44550d9054f5) is now live on the test network, and will replace Arbitrum’s existing VMs with WASM-Geth, optimizing performance and adaptability. (We can talk more about the potential of WASM in a later article)
* Optimism: launched token, on which many “groundbreaking and incredibly optimistic experiments” have been made (with all sorts of missteps, concealed facts and indifference, and recently often questioned by frustrated users as “the abolitionist prince of the Ethereum Foundation”). [The Bedrock upgrade](https://dev.optimism.io/introducing-optimism-bedrock/) will make the VM MIPS-Geth, doing the same thing as EVM. Optimism developers have also been talking about the [zkMIPS](https://twitter.com/kelvinfichter/status/1522389735897022464) concept, so I wonder if they’ll work in that direction later?
* StarkNet: The cross-chain bridge is not fully open yet. Cairo and StarkNet have built a good development ecosystem, and the game ecosystem is worth watching. StarkEx’s Validium model has also made applications such as dYdX, ImmutableX. StarkNet can also serve as a settlement layer and build L3 on top of L2.
* zkSync: The first to make a more complete zkEVM. 2.0 version of Volition mode gives users the flexibility to choose between zkPorter or Ethereum data availability options.
* Aztec: Privacy zk Rollup for the UTXO model, soon to support the privacy DeFi ecosystem (but additional optimizations are needed due to [the large transaction data size](https://twitter.com/aztecnetwork/status/1535024618561363968)). Although it does not support universal computation, it is one of the few zk Rollups that is truly zk.
* Fuel: V1 is an Optimistic Rollup, and very decentralized. Instead of adapting EVM, V2 is a high performance VM with a UTXO model to support parallel tx processing, aiming to build the fastest execution layer.

In addition to Rollup, which is an Ethereum-based network, there are [these](https://twitter.com/epolynya/status/1532560096433033216):

* everPay: A Layer 2 on Arweave based on [SCP Paradigm](https://foresightventures.medium.com/foresight-ventures-think-outside-the-block-arweave-and-bitcoin-smart-contracts-e6a4e5bb5b23).
* Milkomeda: EVM Rollup on Algorand.
* Orbis: Validium Rollup on Cardano.

The different designs of the Rollup solution have many unique features that have truly served countless users and brought about a better crypto and blockchain experience.

## 2. Rollup, the Bad

After the praise in the previous chapter, we will point out in this section some of the issues that Rollup needs to address:

## a) Centralization😱

**The silky smooth user experience of the Rollup network is obtained by compromising security**, and many components of the network are centralized, although there are three points that can be made to “weasel” around this issue:

1. zk proofs in zk Rollup cannot be falsified mathematically.
2. Users can reconstruct all states by DA on L1.
3. The trust model itself is always a smart contract that can be centralized.

However, the centralization of Rollup still leads to problems of censorship and low security. Currently its centralization is mainly reflected in:

* **Centralized sequencer**: Most of the sequencer for Optimistic Rollup and zk Rollup are centralized. This means that the execution of tx, sequencing, and production of blocks are all supported by a centralized server. Previously Arbitrum was [down](https://offchain.medium.com/todays-arbitrum-sequencer-downtime-what-happened-6382a3066fbc) because of sequencer hardware problems…
* **Centralized upgrades**: Most Rollup networks are upgraded centrally, meaning that the cost of actually hacking an entire Rollup is negligible compared to the billions of TVLs on the network. For example, zkSync is a security council that manages upgrades. Thinking back to the Ronin hack, it is definitely not safe to have billions of dollars depending on the multi-signature of a few people.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1024/1\*LADv9vMNiuGq19szflrrnQ.png)

* **Closed-source components**: Some of Rollup’s key components are closed-source. For example, almost all key components of StarkNet are not open source, and are still developed centrally, without an open source license. This is not so Web3.

In my vision, a network or protocol must ultimately be decentralized and open source, otherwise it goes against the spirit of Crypto and Web3.

## b) Real Performance😱

**Rollup’s current demonstration of super performance is “fake”, the real “finality” is not that good, and there is still room for performance improvement. This is a double-edged sword.**

When a user submits a transaction on L2, he/she will immediately get feedback on the success or failure of the transaction, but this immediate user experience is only the finality on L2.

The data does not achieve L1 finality while it is not submitted to L1 or while prover is still in the proof or it is still in the fraud proof window. That is why Rollup has such a great user experience, because the user actually borrows time through Rollup, allowing the user to get a soft confirmation first.

As a result of the above design, the following problems arise:

* **Fake Finality**: The real finality is when the data is on a real blockchain like Ethereum, so how fast is Rollup’s real finality. In other words (of course if you really want to count TPS, the number of tx’s contained in a batch of data should also be taken into account), how often do they submit data to Ethereum? Here’s [a real analysis with on-chain data](https://twitter.com/bkiepuszewski/status/1533347287400865792).

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*mWSfJuWcmmp-O-XbDFGCgg.png)

* **Inflated TPS**: I personally believe that TPS is an extremely bad metric and should be eliminated now. All kinds of Rollup or blockchains show their power by calculating a super high or at least higher TPS than their competitors by countless pre-conditions and confusing concepts. But in practice, their performance is still not that “Web3”. My ideal true Web3 experience would need to be completely senseless, and the entire network would have to be decentralized.

## c) Economics😱

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1322/1\*EiB1FjMT37FWCeA_K9bw7Q.jpeg)

Using Optimism’s tokens as an example, we examine the business and economic mechanisms of Layer 2 Rollup, the token model, and MEV.

* **Business model**: Rollup’s profit = Layer 2 fees — Layer 1 block space fees (security costs for storing and verifying data on L1, etc.) — computational costs such as node servers. Where, Layer 2 fee = gas fee + MEV + some premium charged by Layer 2. But this business model does not allow users to participate as nodes, only Rollup dev team can earn it. Here are the benefits and costs of Arbitrum and Optimism in terms of Layer 2 fees and Layer 1 block space fees.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1474/1\*_GFW6ou6rrE3kpY-9zrGaQ.png)

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1474/1\*g8byzcWPNRMhb4FyG6OtRw.png)

* **Token model**: Optimism’s network is good, but the token economy is still weak. OP has three fatal problems: 1. no utility, such as the inability to pay for network gas or PoS staking (which of course are not good Rollup utilities though). OP is only for governance. 2. no way to capture the value of network revenue and block space. Sequencer’s profit is not related to the holder. 3. the number of liquidity is very low, and the selling pressure is very high, which is exacerbated by market-making accidents. These problems are not only for Optimism, but other Layer2 Rollups are likely to face these as well.
* **MEV**: Since Rollup is now run on centralized sequencer, all these gains can be captured by Rollup. MEV is a two-sided thing. On the bright side, the Rollup network can embrace the value of MEV to the network, making it an important part of the economic mechanism and incentive for miners after the network is decentralized; on the dark side, the Rollup network needs to eliminate any MEV, as it is often considered an additional tax on users. Arbitrum chooses to “ignore” MEV by adopting a first-come, first-served mechanism, but this places higher hardware requirements on the nodes and reduces the cost of DDoS.

Making the network’s business model decentralized, improving the token mechanism, and dealing with MEV will be the three major obstacles on the way to the Rollup network in terms of token launch and decentralization.

## 3. Endgame Comparison of Optimistic Rollup and zk Rollup

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*sblAjFR2N-FdUNdwmBNdIQ.jpeg)

I don’t want to compare the TPS and other [numeric performance](https://kelvinfichter.com/pages/thoughts/tps-is-dumb/) of the Optimistic and zk Rollups like other posts (read more references at the end of this article if you’re curious), but rather compare them in terms of their nature and characteristics, as well as their long-term end-game performance:

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*dn1SmQcyzoUQMteT9UPtOA.png)

A detailed interpretation of this chart and points of interest are as follows:

1. Development difficulty: In fact, zk Rollup is harder to be built than Optimistic Rollup in terms of EVM compatibility, node configuration requirements, and optimization. This is actually a way to justify the extra proof overhead… Not only does the extra proof overhead perpetuate an extra burden on the performance of the network, but it is also a huge impediment to the technical implementation of EVM compatibility.
2. Easier to add features like privacy: Since we are already using zk, it is much easier to develop a truly private zk-zk Rollup than a zk-Op Rollup. Of course, there are zk-Op Rollup projects like ZKOPRU that are already live.
3. Optimization: For Optimistic Rollup, parallelized tx processing is a straightforward and efficient optimization, while zk Rollup with the same scheme (StarkNet’s [next version](https://medium.com/starkware/starknet-alpha-0-9-0-dce43cf13490) of sequencer can do parallelized execution) will still lose to Optimistic Rollup in the long run (again due to the extra proof overhead). Therefore, zk Rollup will adopt the alternative of Fractal L3 scaling, i.e., continue to build Rollup on top of Rollup. The recursive superpower not only allows L2 to verify that L3’s proof is correct, but also allows L1 to verify that L2’s verification of L3 is correct or not.
4. Optimization implementation: These are derived from the roadmap and the envisioned design solutions, and are not currently in practice. Personally, I think it will take a long time to complete these upgrades. Some of these upgrades have side effects, such as introducing a new mechanism that requires additional trust assumptions.

Although this graph concludes that Optimistic Rollup will outperform zk Rollup in the long run, the trust guaranteed by the math is stronger. **I think the endgame for Rollup performance is Optimistic, but the real overall endgame is zk**.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*Sm3L9QRtTg21ebD77qI3xw.jpeg)

The design is perfect, but the engineering challenge is still huge, and the comparison above is still the same as the TPS comparison, but on paper. We still need to look at the security, decentralization, and actual performance and ecosystem of a Rollup network from a practical point of view.

## 4. Future of Rollup

By comparing Optimistic Rollup with zk Rollup, we actually have a comprehensive view of their future performance optimization options. So what does the future of Rollup look like from other perspectives?

## a) Decentralization

In the decentralized perspective, we focus on the sequencer and contract upgrade problem, **in the future, a Rollup must be decentralized, then the following decentralized design is needed**:

* **Decentralized sequencer**: The consensus mechanism of Optimistic Rollup’s sequencer will basically be a variety of PoS (leader election, MEV auction, rotation mechanism); and zk Rollup’s Hermez-like Proof of Efficiency or Proof of Validity Proof or Tendermint PoS. Of course if the network is a PoS mechanism, then there is actually an additional capital cost.
* **Decentralized contract upgrade**: Contract upgrades should not be managed by multi-sig, but by decentralized governance (involving tokens) or by giving up contract upgrade control (e.g. a non-mandatory upgrade like Uniswap V2 to V3).
* **Multi-lang clients**: Like Ethereum, multi-lang clients are necessary in decentralization to ensure 100% uptime of the network.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*K5k8p4xA22qP4LnqUzB1wQ.png)

As a small side note, a comparison of the Arbiturm and Optimism docs shows that they have [slightly different attitude](https://twitter.com/ChainLinkGod/status/1533618278538457088)to decentralization.

## b) Composability

The composability of Rollup is the ability of smart contracts on different Rollups to read and write directly to each other.

For Rollups on Ethereum, **Ethereum as a settlement layer is a shared bridge between Rollups**. The future composability between Rollups is likely to be mostly through L2 ⇒ L1 ⇒ L2 to form a call (like the [dAMM](https://medium.com/starkware/damm-decentralized-amm-59b329fb4cc3) design by StarkNet).

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*bH4hNT7P1ATTQO3yZhLqmg.png)

The real combinability is difficult to achieve due to the different mechanisms between Rollups, which make the tx cannot be verified against each other. This needs to be explored more.

## c) Feature

For feature expansion, zk Rollup has even more potential. **The concept of L3 makes App-specific Rollup particularly attractive**, and Immutable X has announced that it will deploy additional protocols on StarkNet to enable it to exist as an L3.

The appeal of L3 is:

* **Let the application become a protocol, make its interfaces and services open, and achieve greater composability**
* **L1 as the hour hand, L2 as the minute hand, and L3 as the second hand. Further improve the overall network performance without affecting the L1 pulse.**

The most interesting feature I foresee in L3 will be:

* Privacy L3
* Payment-only L3
* NFT Marketplace L3
* Game Engine L3
* DEX and DeFi L3

But the challenge with L3 is how DA is actually handled. We may use several different models:

* Secured Rollup: Still a Rollup, puts DA on L1 like L2, but may involve more complex exit mechanisms.
* Validium/Optimistic Chain: Have an additional DA layer like L2 or Celestia, which requires additional trust assumptions.

## 5. Conclusion

This is what we need to understand about Rollup.

Beyond that, Rollup has created a myriad of new topics: L3, modular blockchains, data availability solutions, UX enhancements due to account abstraction, new technology stacks, new programming languages, new developers, new auditors…

Everything about Rollup is new, shiny, and yet so early…

**How to “use” blockchain better, like Rollup, is a question worth exploring.**

title: Summer Splash
body:
Warm days ahead…

![Times Square New York](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GFczwIwjd9MVfwvXsSoq8.jpg?height=2400&width=3600)

It’s been a while since I last published. I’m *hopefully* going to start writing more in the following months. As summer starts, I have a feeling this summer will be extra special. 

Last November, I was scrolling Twitter and noticed that one of my friends was attending [NFT NYC](https://www.nft.nyc/). At the time, I was new to crypto and just minted my first NFT. I still had school but decided to book a last-minute flight to NY (a great decision I made).

> *NFT NYC: “The Superbowl of NFTs” -* Coinbase

Going in, I barely knew anyone personally and had no conference tickets. It was only my second time visiting NY.N Since I would be skipping an entire week of school, I wanted to make the most of my time so I decided to build my schedule with side events. I signed up for many side events and attended the ones that interested me.

The week was [electric](https://twitter.com/kch0e/status/1457917861909962757). I remember jumping between 3-4 side events a day while doing my homework. I would come back late at night, get up early in the morning, and repeat this for the next few days. It was incredible meeting people passionately building in the space and learning about various projects. I was blown away by the amount of innovation in web3 and realized I forgot there was a world outside a college town.

[https://twitter.com/kch0e/status/1457917861909962757](https://twitter.com/kch0e/status/1457917861909962757)

Each day, I was excited to have more conversations around the growing NFT space and hear more about the Defi community. From Bitcoin pizza to VR/AR NFT galleries to community talks, I was running all over the place. I even bumped into Vignesh & Anand - holders of Beeple’s First 5000 Days (most expensive NFT bought at $69M). Through the various happy hours/parties, I met a Times Magazine writer who mentioned my NFT rug pull experience in their next crypto [article](https://time.com/6115274/nft-conference-parties-culture/). Not bad to top off the insane week.

> *“One 19-year-old college student from the Midwest, in New York as a representative of his school’s investment club, eagerly introduced himself. He explained that even though he’d recently been the victim of a “rug pull”—in crypto terms, when you invest in a coin and then the creator disappears, tanking the value and taking your investment with them—he was still all-in on the NFT world” -* Raisa Bruner, Time 2030

Since then, I have gone down the web3 rabbit hole. I started hopping on crypto Twitter, began working at Coinbase, and attended too many crypto conferences. These conferences included Art Basel, Miami Hack Week, ETH Denver, and the Solana Hacker House. I think I spent more time in Miami than in my classes combined (oops!). I’m thankful to be able to meet new friends through active communities like [DropoutDAO](https://twitter.com/dropout_dao). 

![Miami Hack Week](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uJHiKfEZd8d2tODvgDDVk.jpg?height=844&width=1125)

Next week, I’ll be attending NFT NYC again but not alone this time. I’m returning to where it all started - the city that supercharged my interest in crypto. This year’s conference will be bigger than ever. I’ll be going with my team at [Pinata](https://www.pinata.cloud/) to engage with the greater web3 community. I look forward to catching up with many familiar faces on Twitter and connecting with new ones through the hundreds of side events hosted.

I’ll also be spending the rest of the summer in NY before heading back to college. Having grown up in the San Francisco Bay Area, New York is a different beast. The lively city has a vibrant atmosphere with energy everywhere. The city really never sleeps. I can’t wait to experience the vibes. Summer 2022 is going to be a movie :)

**I’m ready.**

title: Metaverse Weekly Wrap-Up: June 6–12
body:
## Highlights:

* Illuvium publishes the final results of its Land Sale
* Voxels launches its new island, Chronos
* The Sandbox plans to bring 700,000 new gamers into its metaverse
* Paypal allows users to transfer cryptocurrency from their PayPal accounts to and from digital wallets
* CitiBank forecasts the revenue of the Metaverse to exceed 10x the market cap of crypto

## 1. Market Data & Analysis

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*w7v8Brrsqv6rMBcM)

Major indicators indicate a relative mirrored reflection of last week’s performance. Aggregated land market cap (-0.63%), trading volume (-1.77%) and holder numbers (+0.09%) were all steady for the seven metaverse projects listed on [OneLand](https://oneland.world/).

Given the ongoing bear market and overall decline of recent weeks, both [The Sandbox](https://oneland.world/#/main/sandbox) and [Voxels](https://oneland.world/#/main/cryptovoxel) at least bucked the trend this time round, with both trading volumes and market caps up for the week, in contrast to the rest of the pack.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*DBC1PA6UOeWOmdnw)

Sales of newly minted lands always bring a level of excitement to virtual worlds. [Voxels](https://oneland.world/#/main/cryptovoxel) launched its new island Chronos this week, which helped to reignite buyer sentiment, lifting sales near 50% from 19 to 29. At the same time, with the building auction on Architect Island last week retreating from the spotlight, the average parcel price suffered a decline (-14.59%).

[Worldwide Webb](https://oneland.world/#/main/worldwideweb3) suffered drops in volume (-42%) and average price (-17%) for the week. Though landholders competed for places on the scoreboard in [Worldwide Webb](https://oneland.world/#/main/worldwideweb3) as part of the promotional activities surrounding the news of V2, the activity seems to have brought little more attention to the metaverse.

[The Sandbox](https://oneland.world/#/main/sandbox) held several contests and raffles in the past seven days. It also cemented a partnership with GamerHash with stated plans to bring its community of 700,000 gamers to the Metaverse. In the midst of a bear market, it makes a lot of sense to settle down and get things done, and the news may have had some impact. [The Sandbox](https://oneland.world/#/main/sandbox)’s market cap increased 2.29%, while sales numbers as well as the average price were also up, though very marginally.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*98luwFxN3uGdokl3)

Sales in [Decentraland](https://oneland.world/#/main/decentraland) dipped 20% this week, registering a 15% decline in trading volume. It’s worth noting however that an [Estate](https://etherscan.io/tx/0xc0fb601079d7119994b572a3f4c25ed16a99edb2bcb108157f7709625d8ca040) sold this week at a price of 49.9 ETH. That, and [another LAND ](https://etherscan.io/tx/0x74ae5db8162f0a11eed908cd31b5dffc6503f1d03feff8dfa692ffa5f198999d)sale for 24.95 ETH were enough to push the average price up by 6.53%.

It was not a good week for [Somnium Space](https://oneland.world/#/main/somniumspace), registering only 1 sale, the metaverse’s land cap sinking another 6.88%. Meanwhile, the sheer magnitude of [Otherside](https://oneland.world/#/main/otherside) has ensured that trading of Otherdeeds still continues to outperform the land sales of all other virtual worlds.

Also widely reported this week was the fact that global NFT sales have been on a steady downslide, having plunged as much as 70% (depending on the number of projects and blockchains included in the calculations) in the past month alone. Meanwhile, virtual land NFTs, while correspondingly feeling the impacts of a crypto winter along with other NFTs, have yet to experience the same level of decline. The Metaverse remains the youngest, hottest and most talked-about space in the whole of Web3 right now

*For comprehensive market and metaverse project data, check [oneland.world](https://oneland.world/)*.

## 2. Market News

### Illuvium

* **June 5**

Illuvium released its final results from its Land Sale earlier this month. In total, 19,969 plots of land were sold for a total of $72.2m, with 239,388 sILV2 to be burned.​​

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*v0POsviiHUkqKeme)

### Voxels

* **June 7**

Voxels launched their new island [Chronos](https://www.voxels.com/buy).

Chronos Island has 400 parcels divided up into 4 districts of 100 parcels each. The districts are themed by season: Summer, Autumn, Winter and Spring.

### Decentraland

* **June 8**

The [May MetaMoment commemorative Wearable](https://market.decentraland.org/contracts/0x7e03cb1eb02aacfd5fdec88ced4aefa1015c4f86/items/0) from the DCL Report went on sale in Decentraland’s marketplace.

### Other Market News

* **June 6**

Apple [announced plans](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/04/business/apple-virtual-reality-headset.html) to launch a new VR/AR headset in January 2023 to compete with Google, Microsoft and Meta (Facebook).

* **June 7**

Paypal [announced](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/paypal-finally-allowing-users-move-153603017.html) a feature that allows users to transfer cryptocurrency from their PayPal accounts to and from digital wallets and exchanges.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OT-cCAkFJFo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OT-cCAkFJFo)

* **June 7**

CitiBank [reports](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/07/metaverse-related-economy-could-be-as-much-as-13-trillion-citi/) the revenue potential of the Metaverse to be over 10x the market cap of all crypto, or around $1.25 trillion.

* **June 8**

Hyundai Card announced a [joint venture](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/hyundai-card-building-first-nft-070116497.html) with Like Lion to launch an NFT marketplace and wallet service.

* **June 9**

Web3 creator economy protocol DEIP [announced](https://twitter.com/arhead_io/status/1533699457916739585?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1533699457916739585%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_c10&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.xrtoday.com%2Fmixed-reality%2Fdeip-opens-first-creator-community-metaverse-city%2F) it opened its Metaverse City with the collaboration of creators, 3D artists and meta-architects. The new virtual city on the Arhead Metaverse provides Web3 solutions, digital ownership and monetisation opportunities.

## 3. Events

### The Sandbox

* **June 6**

The Sandbox hosted a [Twitter Space](https://twitter.com/TheSandboxGame/status/1533773988224290817?s=20&t=lpQxEAp_uhBw_8EqQRwGuQ) with People of Crypto to discuss the first diversity and inclusion hub in the Metaverse, AlphaVerse, and the upcoming Avatar mint.

### Somnium Space

* **June 6**

Somnium Space auctioned permanent banner slots on [OpenSea](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x495f947276749ce646f68ac8c248420045cb7b5e/66757362189801157372462733582640535105284511657013989059937975703676420882433).

The Front Page Banner NFT holder secured permanent rights to place ads under the main slider on [Somnium Times](https://somniumtimes.com/)’ front page. The holders also gain permanent advertising space in Somnium Space HQ.

### Voxels

* **June 8**

Voxels held a [Twitter Space](https://twitter.com/cryptovoxels/status/1534325822206922752?s=20&t=D0IhDkxV9f2fVeBCXNERyQ) to talk about better integration with [yofolk](https://www.yofolk.com/) and AR plug-in [Foxus](https://www.foxus.com/).

### Decentraland

* **June 9**

Hyundai launched the New Creta in Decentraland. In the New Creta, players can view virtual cars, enjoy live music and collect free wearables.

[https://events.decentraland.org/event/?id=f33a1b81-632e-4fa2-9f49-06cc0905c135](https://events.decentraland.org/event/?id=f33a1b81-632e-4fa2-9f49-06cc0905c135)

* **June 9**

Decentraland live-streamed feature talks and presentations from the Metaverse stage at Consensus 2022.

[https://events.decentraland.org/event/?id=cbeeaed7-fe78-4c39-88b7-abacbf2d7f5c](https://events.decentraland.org/event/?id=cbeeaed7-fe78-4c39-88b7-abacbf2d7f5c)

* **June 11**

The [Metaverse Pride parade ](https://events.decentraland.org/event/?id=86fffbf4-1f41-479f-9622-a36f8959570f)kicked off with amazing performances on the Rainbow Stage. The parade runs live 24/7 until the end of June.

[https://decentraland.org/blog/announcements/metaverse-pride-in-decentraland/](https://decentraland.org/blog/announcements/metaverse-pride-in-decentraland/)

## 4. Contests

### The Sandbox

* **June 7**

The Sandbox and Elvis On-Chain held a landholder-only [raffle](https://www.premint.xyz/Elvis-On-Chain-TSB/) for 200 Backstage Passes/ WL spots for the upcoming Elvis Genesis Keys mint.

* **June 8**

Coinbase held a[ giveaway](https://www.coinbase.com/sweepstakes/q2_june_22_trading?__cf_chl_f_tk=PmbBQ9TEW8a5rUGQDMGXXbCIAixpzE7FSCQoevJMoIc-1654741315-0-gaNycGzNCJE) with The Sandbox to celebrate the listing of $SAND on Coinbase. People who buy $100 in total (including fees) of SAND on Coinbase by 06/21/22 are eligible to win.

[https://www.coinbase.com/sweepstakes/q2_june_22_trading?__cf_chl_f_tk=PmbBQ9TEW8a5rUGQDMGXXbCIAixpzE7FSCQoevJMoIc-1654741315-0-gaNycGzNCJE](https://www.coinbase.com/sweepstakes/q2_june_22_trading?__cf_chl_f_tk=PmbBQ9TEW8a5rUGQDMGXXbCIAixpzE7FSCQoevJMoIc-1654741315-0-gaNycGzNCJE)

### Decentraland

* **June 9**

Meta Trekkers held a [giveaway](https://twitter.com/MetaTrekkers/status/1534579134504239104?s=20&t=tzKO2km_ZwY1KzybBJibAQ) on Twitter to celebrate it becoming an official Decentraland Point of Interest (POI). 100 winners win a WL spot and new wearable.

### Worldwide Webb

* **June 9**

Worldwide Webb held a [Landholder Giveaway](https://twitter.com/Worldwide_WEB3/status/1534928891147583488?s=20&t=tzKO2km_ZwY1KzybBJibAQ) in Webb Defenders.

Landholders who gain a score of over 1M enter the raffle, with winners getting to mint [MV3 access passes](https://opensea.io/collection/mv3-access-passes).

## 5. Project Updates

### Somnium Space

* **June 7**

Somnium Space launched its [Alpha+ Quest standalone VR Client](https://gitlab.com/somnium-space-public/somnium-quest-client-alpha-release/-/releases/0.0.1.5).

### The Sandbox

* **June 10**

The Sandbox has teamed up with Mastercard to [bring its payment network to the blockchain](https://mpost.io/mastercard-embraces-web3-by-introducing-nft-payment-service/). The financial services firm is also working with Immutable X, Moonpay, Candy Digital, Nifty Gateway and Mintable, and will allow card purchases for NFTs and other blockchain services on these companies’ marketplaces.

## 6. Partnerships

## **The Sandbox**

* **June 7**

The Sandbox has partnered with GamerHash, a 700,000-strong Web3 gaming community, to bring new game experiences to the Metaverse. Gamerhash has already acquired a 6x6 ESTATE in The Sandbox, and plans to kick off with its first game TRAVERSE: Mars is Mine.

[https://sandboxgame.medium.com/gamerhash-partners-with-the-sandbox-to-bring-700-000-gamers-to-the-metaverse-1e72f20c7d52](https://sandboxgame.medium.com/gamerhash-partners-with-the-sandbox-to-bring-700-000-gamers-to-the-metaverse-1e72f20c7d52)

* **June 10**

The Sandbox collaborated with The Museum of Contemporary Digital Art (MoCDA) to bring [two digital art exhibitions](https://medium.com/sandbox-game/annoucing-mocda-exhibitions-in-the-sandbox-metaverse-146d3f55bfc2) to the Metaverse — Revisiting the Future (June 10–24) and Impossible Worlds (June 24 — July 8).

### Worldwide Webb

* **June 12**

Worldwide Webb announced the [integration of Boki NFT](https://twitter.com/Worldwide_WEB3/status/1536074836837113856). All Boki holders will be able to use the new default skin after the public launch of V2.

body:

熊市深耕，牛市收获，Gitcoin的捐赠一直是 Web3 的武器库，但行好事莫问前程，说不定在下次牛市中，你播下的种子已长成参天大树。

这篇文章，让我们一起回顾一下这次Gitcoin捐赠中的，23个ZK生态项目。

![a4033140a3f0f2c79d171ccc6f32d29.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655173971765820.png)

该赠款旨在资助开发 Dune 仪表板以跟踪 Aztec上的链上活动。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/4276/dune-dashboards-for-aztec-protocol

### **2.OtterCash**

![c3c78e965990870058ffd87f93b1ca0.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655173978841602.png)

OtterCash 正在 Solana 上构建开源的、便宜的零知识开发工具。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/5013/otter-cash-cheap-zk-on-solana

### **3.cabalxyz**

![5e042cfe06083772e8aa5d758ad5602.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655173987931765.png)

Cabalxyz 是一个 Discord 的机器人，它允许服务器所有者使用 ETH 身份（即 NFT 所有权）控制对频道的访问，同时允许用户维护他们的隐私。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/5394/cabalxyz

### **4.Circify**

![84a72a25b26b83914ceeed30caa467b.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655173994805134.png)

Circify 是一个编译器构建工具包，可以轻松构建从高级、有状态语言（如 C）到电路（和其他类似约束的表示）的编译器。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/4877/correct-programs-and-compilers-with-circ

### **5.Iden3**

![1ecbf42a957535c2b44139d671f95c7.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174011242461.png)

Identhree 正在寻求资助 Circom，这是一种电路编程语言和编译器，允许程序员为 ZK 证明设计和创建自己的算术电路。

赠款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/4825/circom-efficient-circuit-framework-for-programmab

### **6.ZKHack**

![335e24198829b439d23cd4e1741d836.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174024713505.png)

ZK HACK是一个在线系列活动和专注于 ZK 的社区！通过入门研讨会和高级解谜比赛、学习小组和视频系列，ZK Hack旨在教参与者如何使用 ZK 工具。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/3595/zk-hack-zk-focused-virtual-event

### **7.Sin7Y**

![00fef6a3167b11eaede2b69f9f0ad77.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174027584398.png)

Sin7Y 是一个小型项目孵化器和区块链技术研究团队。Sin7Y 由顶尖的区块链开发人员提供支持，分析最前沿的技术，包括 ZK-EVM、Layer2、跨链、隐私计算、自主支付解决方案等。他们每周在 HackMD 和 Medium 上发布报告。

赠款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/5351/zk-tech-weekly-reports

![cbb1bd36e44960d268d0204c754b4ba.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174112952837.png)

Blaine 是一位对 Web 技术、开源、去中心化虚拟世界的未来和 ZK 应用程序感到兴奋的开发人员。Blaine Bublitz 为 ETH/ZK 应用程序开发构建基础设施。他还与 Dark Forest 团队和其他 0xPARC 相邻项目密切合作。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/4213/blaine-bublitz-ethzk-infrastructure-ecosystem-dev

### **9.ZK Travel Scholarships**

![1cecbf666c6a5013ba013f26160ada0.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174053226639.png)

ZK Travel Scholarships，由 0xPARC 和斯坦福 CBR 提供。他们的 ZK 旅行奖学金将资助密码学研究生和零知识研究人员，他们正在寻求支持以参加区块链和密码学会议。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/4965/zk-travel-scholarships-by-0xparc-and-stanford-cbr

### **10.ZeroPool**

![d8b4633b66edfba0afa05cf66e2124b.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174075645196.png)

ZeroPool 是区块链的隐私引擎，允许发送完全匿名、非托管的交易。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/172/zeropool-scaling-anonymous-transactions-for-block

### **11.Zk Ape**

![c7a9afce494bfa11d055b37887508cf.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174070569931.png)

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/3372/zkape-turkish-newsletter-about-zeroknowledge

### **12.Least Authority**

![c0d481c956411fc2a6c044c7a499dca.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174127850321.png)

LeastAuthority 希望通过其 MoonMath Manual to zk-SNARKs 让每个人都可以访问 zk-SNARKS 知识，该手册专为密码学和编程经验最少的观众而设计。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/543/the-moonmath-manual-to-zk-snarks

### **13.ZKML**

![7f038b141d8c72dda51c5630075e6dd.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174136307845.png)

0xZKML 的目标是教读者如何在 zkSNARK 中创建和使用机器学习基础。

捐款链接:https://gitcoin.co/grants/4847/zkml

### **14.ZKxZK**

![26206b6cff8af01f56f1f77e920ba45.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174097765146.png)

0xZKxZK 是一项开源技术，旨在为椭圆曲线密码学 (ECC) 和基于配对的密码学 (PBC) 的基础设施实现有效的概念验证 ZK 电路。

捐款链接：https://gitcoin.co/grants/4934/zkxzk-zksnark-circuits-for-crypto-primitives

### **15.0xPARC**

![01c44a2a3d2108aebb2ff123ca0ee76.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174156365943.png)

0xPARC 是一个教育计划，将一群扎实的技术专家（工程师、研究人员、开源开发人员等）带入应用 ZK 空间。

![95392e2a3ec276ad2c27af87636ad2e.png](https://www.techflow520.com/storage/u/image/20220614/1655174166817148.png)

zkREPL 是一个交互式游乐场，初学者和专家都可以在这里轻松地找到并构建基于 zk-SNARK 技术的新的和创造性的系统。

title: Summer Splash
body:
Warm days ahead…

![Times Square New York](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GFczwIwjd9MVfwvXsSoq8.jpg?height=2400&width=3600)

It’s been a while since I last published. I’m *hopefully* going to start writing more in the following months. As summer starts, I have a feeling this summer will be extra special. 

Last November, I was scrolling Twitter and noticed that one of my friends was attending [NFT NYC](https://www.nft.nyc/). At the time, I was new to crypto and just minted my first NFT. I still had school but decided to book a last-minute flight to NY (a great decision I made).

> *NFT NYC: “The Superbowl of NFTs” -* Coinbase

Going in, I barely knew anyone personally and had no conference tickets. It was only my second time visiting NY. Since I would be skipping an entire week of school, I wanted to make the most of my time so I decided to build my schedule with side events. I signed up for many side events and attended the ones that interested me.

The week was [electric](https://twitter.com/kch0e/status/1457917861909962757). I remember jumping between 3-4 side events a day while doing my homework. I would come back late at night, get up early in the morning, and repeat this for the next few days. It was incredible meeting people passionately building in the space and learning about various projects. I was blown away by the amount of innovation in web3 and realized I forgot there was a world outside a college town.

[https://twitter.com/kch0e/status/1457917861909962757](https://twitter.com/kch0e/status/1457917861909962757)

Each day, I was excited to have more conversations around the growing NFT space and hear more about the Defi community. From Bitcoin pizza to VR/AR NFT galleries to community talks, I was running all over the place. I even bumped into Vignesh & Anand - holders of Beeple’s First 5000 Days (most expensive NFT bought at $69M). Through the various happy hours/parties, I met a Times Magazine writer who mentioned my NFT rug pull experience in their next crypto [article](https://time.com/6115274/nft-conference-parties-culture/). Not bad to top off the insane week.

> *“One 19-year-old college student from the Midwest, in New York as a representative of his school’s investment club, eagerly introduced himself. He explained that even though he’d recently been the victim of a “rug pull”—in crypto terms, when you invest in a coin and then the creator disappears, tanking the value and taking your investment with them—he was still all-in on the NFT world” -* Raisa Bruner, Time 2030

Since then, I have gone down the web3 rabbit hole. I started hopping on crypto Twitter, began working at Coinbase, and attended too many crypto conferences. The conference list includes Art Basel, Miami Hack Week, ETH Denver, and a Solana Hacker House. I think I spent more time in Miami than in my classes combined (oops!). I’m thankful to be able to meet new friends through active communities like [DropoutDAO](https://twitter.com/dropout_dao). 

![Miami Hack Week](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uJHiKfEZd8d2tODvgDDVk.jpg?height=844&width=1125)

Next week, I’ll be attending NFT NYC again but not alone this time. I’m returning to where it all started - the city that supercharged my interest in crypto. This year’s conference will be bigger than ever. I’ll be going with my team at [Pinata](https://www.pinata.cloud/) to engage with the greater web3 community. I look forward to catching up with many familiar faces on Twitter and connecting with new ones through the hundreds of side events hosted.

I’ll also be spending the rest of the summer in NY before heading back to college. Having grown up in the San Francisco Bay Area, New York is a different beast. The lively city has a vibrant atmosphere with energy everywhere. The city really never sleeps. I can’t wait to experience the vibes. Summer 2022 is going to be a movie :)

**I’m ready.**

title: 既做飞机又做空中滴滴 - ArrowDAO的野望
body:
> 10天前我写了一篇关于ArrowDAO激励结构的帖子，把它作为一个案例拆解分析，但并未详细介绍ArrowDAO本身。ArrowDAO的目标是做垂直起降载人机及拼机网络，这个方向看起来太有趣了，于是我收到了不少小伙伴私信想让我介绍下它的具体情况。我自己对它的整体情况并不那么了解，而我也对它充满了好奇。于是我和ArrowDAO的发起人Thomas约了个时间通话聊了一下。
>
> 这篇介绍是根据通话了解的信息以及我在公开渠道收集的一些信息汇集而成。 我个人暂时没有参与到ArrowDAO的任何具体工作当中，这意味着我的理解会是肤浅的，并可能有一些错误信息。它是一个非常开放的DAO，感兴趣的小伙伴建议自己花时间去看。

**目标** - 为每个人带来私人航空飞行。

要实现这一目标，ArrowDAO打算这么做。

1. 用开源硬件的方式设计低成本垂直起降飞行器(VTOL)，使得其可以大批量制造。
2. 开发拼机协议。
3. 拼机协议运行在以太坊网络上并构建出一个围绕个人飞行的价值共享网络，最终实现全球性的市场覆盖。

**总结就是，先搞个飞行汽车出来，再做Web3版的空中拼机协议，最终让大家都能打得到空中滴滴。**

**VTOL**
VTOL(Vertical Take-off and Landing) Aircraft- **垂直起降飞行器**。这个词对于包括我的大部分人都是很陌生的概念。不过在科技创投圈这是个挺热的方向。VTOL能应用在多个方向，而用于载人的VTOL更是被大家视为交通的未来方向之一。

这个方向已经诞生了多家独角兽和上市公司，包括来自中国的小鹏。小鹏汇天是一个飞行汽车公司，去年底他作为独立项目融资5亿美金。所以ArrowDAO要做的事情并不是个异想天开的事，而是已经被大量创业者和投资者盯住的方向，并且可能已经处在爆发的前夜。

**路线图**
阶段0 — 形成社区，迭代核心想法，建立初始财库，设计并制造试验无人机。这一阶段的其他任务都已经完成，随着试验无人机的完成这个阶段将结束，预期是**8月30日**。

阶段1 — 开发拼机协议，开发量产版货运飞行器，发掘活跃市场，获得认证并开始商业飞行。

阶段2 — 开发载人飞行器原型，测试飞行，获得安全认证，量产。

后两个阶段目前并没有具体时间表。考虑到ArrowDAO目前还非常早期，而目标又是如此困难，给不出时间表也合理的，即使给出一个来，大概也会变化。而阶段2大概也并不是ArrowDAO的终点。

**矛头**
作为早期路线图的一部分，ArrowDAO已经启动了一个无人机研发项目，这个项目的内部代号叫“矛头”。

该机的设计指标是**20公斤，翼展3米**，跟大疆这类拍照用的无人机比要大很多，但离载人标准还有很大的差距。这个无人机可能用来做货运比较合适（飞行版闪送？​），不过作为一个试验品，它并没有承载真正的商业目的，**研发这款飞机的真正目的是用来验证如何通过互联网协助的方式完成一款飞机的研发，设计，制造，试飞等过程**。

![原型方案之一(非最终方案)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/csLat25ygp5loTV_SIDGc.png?height=751&width=1512)

![最终方案应该是这个](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WhjivNISPAWPkXrXT-oOG.png?height=1175&width=2475)

![螺旋桨性能评估](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cHmpUCQMk4Z2zXNgkqah7.png?height=1082&width=1840)

![试验机的时间表](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RZz5ICz2uCN3fDJeA-oK5.png?height=414&width=1170)

截至目前有6个人参与了实验机的开发，分别负责了整体设计，电子系统，电池，螺旋叶片，仿生设计，测试，制造等。实验无人机的预计试飞时间是8月31日。

**合规**
问及Thomas未来最大的障碍是什么。答案是合规。各国针对飞行器都有严格的监管。而未来要进入大规模商业载人飞行，更是几乎重建立一整套的空域使用规则。即使是目前的试验性无人机，可能也需要把试飞场放到南美洲或非洲。

**资金**
做这么大的事，要很多钱吧？肯定的。ArrowDAO的发起人Thomas上一次进入公众的视野并不是因为ArrowDAO，而是他在2月的时候差点被假授权攻击被人骗了一亿多美金，这是他在加密领域的大部分资产。于是大家都知道了，这兄弟很有钱。

ArrowDAO的第一笔注入资金就来自于Thomas的捐赠，包括519.3个以太坊和150万USDC。这么有零有整的数字我猜是按捐赠时候的市值，凑了250万美金（现在已经跌到了180万美金）。

但这事不可能永远靠发起人输血，而且就算Thomas把钱全捐了也未必够。还记得小鹏飞行汽车的第一轮融资吗，5亿美金。未来随着工作有了一定进展，ArrowDAO大概率会寻求资本方进行多轮输血。而按目前的消耗速度，即使考虑到未来消耗逐渐增大，坚持18个月应该还是很轻松的。跟其他手持大量资金的玩家比，ArrowDAO的资金体量小的不止一个量级，他需要在有限的时间内证明自己，从而解锁未来的财务支持。

**贡献及激励** 

这一部分在之前的Case Study已经拆解的比较详细，可以跳转阅读([DAO如何做激励-ArrowDAO](https://chao.mirror.xyz/2rZgU-vrMLZlRV7LPo9rp3lavHMGBGmUJhyS1PvLrsA))。

ArrowDAO的对所有人开放，但并不是无许可制，大部分工作对技能有要求，能否真正加入贡献取决于一套评估机制。核心的工作以两个月为一个周期推进，在两个月内有相对固定的贡献者。绝大部分贡献者目前是业余时间参与，能拿到2000–8000美元不等的收入。由于目前还在早期，ArrowDAO可能也没有足够的的全职空间和预算给大家。

**$ARROW**
ARROW是Arrow的治理凭证。\*\*Arrow Token不卖，只发给贡献者，并且有超长的解锁周期。所以未来很长一段时间内（1–2年）市场上根本不会有Arrow流通。\*\*这是为了减少投机以及避免Token的价格波动给社区造成影响。一个5万人但全是投机者潜水员的discord服务器并不见得比只有100认真贡献者的服务器有质量。

未来Arrow Token会被用作网络激励、贡献者奖励、治理及资助研究，Arrow更主要的部分预留给未来通过Token聚合起来的共享网络 ，飞行员，运营商（机队），物业(提供降落地)，充电站都会是这个网络的一部分。

但由于太过早期，一切都存在很大的变数，ArrowDAO并未真正定义出自己的Tokennomic。

**如何和其他制造商竞争**
通话中我问Thomas，小鹏第一轮就拿了五亿美金。其他的几家也都手持巨款，你们怎么竞争。Thomas回答我们不一定竞争。这个领域有太多未攻克的难题，而很多方面往往是通用的，完全可以合作。

另外我猜未来的Arrow飞机和空中出租网络并不一定是相互唯一绑定关系，如果真能走到那一天，应该也会支持第三方飞行器加入空中出租网络。

**最后** 这是一群梦想家和硬核工程师构成的DAO。它的目标是如此宏大以至于大部分人都不会相信互联网上的一些陌生人能够聚在一起来实现它。不过回到多年前大家可能也不会相信今天我们的互联网服务是构建在互联网上的陌生人一起做出来的操作系统上。

开源软件已经探索出来很成熟的模式，而开源硬件要比开源软件要复杂很多，空中拼车网更是对技术、合规、运营等方面有更大的要求。但有这么一群人希望并相信 web3 领域出现的新组织结构将使研究人员、投资者、工程师和其他人团结一致，共同解决这些艰巨的问题。

欢迎来一起创造天空的未来。

title: What is Bu Zhi DAO?
body:
This writing aims to introduce what **Bu Zhi DAO** is, how it came about, what we have planned for in the future and how you can get involved!

### What is Bu Zhi DAO?

Our official mission statement is **“Bu Zhi DAO is a collective of builders, creators and investors passionate about advancing Taiwan’s web3 ecosystem and culture“**

In more detail, BZD is a Taiwan focused DAO aimed to connect people in the web3 space who have a connection to or are passionate about Taiwan’s web3 ecosystem and culture. We want to build a fun and welcoming community that encourages genuine IRL connection, collaboration, helping each other, and having a blast along the way.

The name “BuZhiDAO” is a pun in mandarin, meaning “I don’t know”. We also want to help educate and promote web3 by creating public resources and content to help people learn more about web3, bridge different communities in web2 and web3, and share Taiwanese culture in the metaverse.

Connect.Build.Educate.

### How it came about..

Like many DAOs, we started off as a group chat with frens from ETH Denver in February. After ETH Denver, we realized the powerful connection of builders and genuine people in web3 that we wanted to take this idea to its full fruition. The mission statement went through tens of iterations to get to where we are, not because we didn’t know what we wanted to do, but there was too much we wanted to do that it was so hard to encapsulate it well in a few sentences.

The group chat grew and grew from 4 people to close to 200, we had meet ups in major cities in the US - NY / LA / Taiwan / SF and various conferences Permission-less, Consensus.

![LA](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qyxkfRHl_Y3VfdqCjPvKh.jpg?height=960&width=1280)

![New York](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lUARWTQWWgv5OFSMgKgQK.jpg?height=960&width=1280)

![San Francisco](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9KPw5X-S2F3y535frX5tx.jpg?height=960&width=1280)

![Taiwan](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fK4QPA_5vSp01jJLsidDs.jpg?height=960&width=1280)

### What are we building?

We defined our roadmap, made a pitch deck and fund raised 40 ETH for our $IDK tokens initial offering back in May.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0XTg6VsP615re3L0zfG0Y.png?height=660&width=1186)

Since then, members have been working hard to continue to build and expand our community and fulfill the roadmap and beyond.

Our first podcast episode talks about why we started this DAO with more background story and some of the vision. You can listen to the [preview](https://twitter.com/buzhidao_tw/status/1532769336628236293?s=20&t=cTIyTuGZ0TOn3CykX15VhQ) here and the full episode on multiple platforms on [Apple](https://apple.co/38L6HmW), [Spotify](https://spoti.fi/3tgmhOx), [YouTube](https://youtu.be/HKGe4dIhC0Y) with subtitles

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/anxht9pmSFDyXNvW4iwVt.jpg?height=720&width=1280)

We’ve also started a workshop series #想知道 to help people learn useful and relevant web3 topics

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Gu3d29UtENVXhiL9t-QLn.jpg?height=1080&width=1080)

Our first public facing event will also be happening during NFT NYC in collaboration with TAP NY - a perfect marriage for us considering our mission to bridge different Taiwanese communities and bring more people from web2 to web3. Would love for you to join us! [Pick up a free ticket here](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/proxy-presents-taiwan-crypto-night-with-tap-ny-x-buzhidao-tickets-358818625167)

![Sponsored by Proxy: a better chat and social platform for web3 where communities come together. ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JeHVsFGphPAO7ehrZvFOX.png?height=720&width=1440)

### Get involved!

It’s been an amazing journey for us seeing all these people coming together for this shared mission and selflessly contributing their time and effort, a separate post is required to share all the leanings and lessons we had along the way.

If this mission speaks to you and you want to contribute or connect with us, feel free to join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/p9agnPsApA) and introduce yourself! If you are interested in officially joining the DAO after, feel free to fill out this [membership application form](https://www.buzhidao.tw/application). We are currently organized into pods - Infra, Product, Growth and Capital, and we’d love for you to join our mission.

Follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/buzhidao_tw) to see all the dank memes and stay in the 知 DAO

*A big goal of ours was to help organize and sponsor ETH Taipei at the end of the year before it was recently cancelled due to quarantine and border control rules. We still plan to make something happen, if this is something of interest to you and your organization, do reach out!*

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Wo-TFBADq4EZ8oQ1qILJS.png?height=799&width=1894)

title: Mad Finance | the ad protocol for web3 social 💸
body:
## Traditional ad networks are ready for disruption

The main financial engine of a web2 social app is its ad network; scrolling through your feed is free because multiple brands have paid for ad space. At the same time traditional social media platforms fail to compensate the content creators that bring engagement to their platform; they aren’t compensated for their banger tweets, IG posts, or videos. These platforms harvest your data, make ad money off the attention of creators, and ultimately turn you into the product.

Web3 makes this model obsolete. Utilizing open social graphs and programmable tokens, we can democratize access to ad revenue, paying content creators their fair share of the attention they bring to platforms.

![https://a16zcrypto.com/state-of-crypto-report-a16z-2022/](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9t4EdqdLBkR8CcWlM1ThK.jpg?height=872&width=1536)

## Mad Finance connects sponsors with web3 publishers and influencers via real-time money streams, giving content creators the opportunity to directly collect the 💸 💸 💸 they deserve

There has been a lot of experimentation with DeFi, NFTs, and DAOs, including the combination of these. However, **web3 social** is a new playing field that the team behind the [Lens Protocol](http://lens.xyz/) has opened the gates for. The protocol is modular by design and encourages experimentation on the client side as well as the protocol side.

On the client side, we have user interfaces such as [Lenster](https://lenster.xyz/) and [Lenstube](https://lenstube.xyz) that aim to re-create the experiences we’re grown accustomed to such as social apps and video streaming platforms - yet they use the same social graph under the hood.

On the protocol side, developers are able to build smart contract modules that execute on follow/comment/re-share. W**e** can combine all the best experiments of the last three years to create a new experience on a similar social interface.

![Your Lens profile is an NFT, your posts are ownable, and you can control the re-shares](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LHWtvldnzHv-_qYVAhQ6b.png?height=522&width=800)

## At Mad Finance, we are building a suite of products in the form of Lens modules, a platform for campaign creation + management, and an SDK for distribution channels

What a started as a [hackathon finalist project](https://twitter.com/ETHGlobal/status/1509222875223441408) has turned into an ambitious project to rethink the ad network model in favor of content creators, and ultimately the users that provide valuable insights to marketers. We’re leading this effort with a few key ideas

* everything on the internet that can be an NFT, will be an NFT
* NFTs have the potential to be the next version of the browser cookie
* using NFTs and DeFi, we can reward users in ways not possible before

## We are inviting brands and creators to participate in the evolution of advertising + marketing

Our first product will be carrying the idea of [Lens Follow NFTs](https://docs.lens.xyz/docs/follow) to the next level - allowing influencers and brands to utilize them as marketing campaigns. We’re opening up a platform to allow Lens users to customize their limited edition Follow NFT that mints for all new followers. **These NFTs are more than just images - they can be redeemables, gate digital + IRL experiences, and open the door for loyalty programs.**

## In the future, we expect all brands to seek exposure through decentralized social media. Direct connections with influencers will create new kinds of relationships and distribution channels for content, while the on-chain nature of these ads will bring further composability, automation, and transparency to the industry

title: 什么时候抄底？
body:
比特币行情分析（2022年6月 14日）--------推特：比特币橙子Trader；（看我推特，不迷路；如果你关注我、转发我、点赞我和评论我，你会暴富，不信你试试！\~\~）

【昨日复盘】   昨晚美股杀疯了，道指收跌2.79%，纳指收跌4.68%，创2020年10月以来的收盘新低，标普500指数收跌3.88%，指标显示已经跌入熊市。黄金也没能幸免，高开低走，最终收跌3.07%，报1819.41美元每盎司。造成这一系列跌幅的原因就是美联储本周四加息75基点的可能性增大，当前美联储官员处于噤声期不能对外发声，然后华尔街那边的记者开始写文章给市场渗透加息75基点的可能性，自从CPI数据出炉以后，整个市场就比较疯狂，这样超预期的数据谁也没能想到，这就更加坚定了美联储加息降通胀的决心。

自1994年以来，美联储还从未有过一次性加息75基点的时候，然后昨晚华尔街日报首席经济记者Nick Timiraos发表了一篇文章，这篇文章其实有点不普通，首先是时间选择在加息前三天发表，然后这样的职位不普通，另外美联储经常透过华尔街日报向市场传递重大信号。看完之后大概有4个层面的概括，第一个是美联储官员的展望取决于经济形势是否符合预期，上周的通胀数据超越了预期，这是事实。第二个是最近两项消费者调查数据显示家庭对未来通胀的预期有所增加，这是实际造成的现实影响。第三个是鲍威尔上个月也说过美联储将根据未来经济数据来决定加息基数。第四个是投行巴克莱和Jefferies在内的几家华尔街预测机构表示，预计美联储本周加息75基点。所以从这样的节奏来看的话，本周大概率加息75基点，这是远远超过了此前市场的预期，此前市场预期都是50基点，所以这样的决策发生之后市场肯定是无法承受的，下跌无法避免。

回到加密市场，最近好多同学私信问我能不能抄底以及什么时候抄底，这个时候我觉得就不要着急了，首先宏观层面不确定性太大了，这样的不确定性会非常影响市场走势，所以这时候应该是拿着现金持续观望阶段，如果做反弹行情的话至少也要等到底部放量支撑信号出现。如果是长线趋势线仓位的话，那就更不着急了，有的是时间建仓，根本就不用担心错过低价筹码，每一次市场都会给大家足够的进行建仓。

牛市的时候杠杆太大，导致现在比特币、以太坊正在清算杠杆的路上，所以大家也可以看到山寨基本上跌不动了，只有主流资产还没止跌，这足够可以说明了问题，现在选择抛售的就是私自加了杠杆的机构，资本等等，这一切的一切源于DK的LUNA和UST，市场逐渐成熟之后，这个圈子里的项目之间都有直接或间接的关联性，如果暴雷，那么会有一连串的连锁反应，UST再一次给大家上了一课。

红杉资本旗下Sequoia India and Southeast Asia宣布推出两只新基金，分别是红杉资本印度早期风险和成长基金（规模约20亿美元）与红杉资本东南亚专属基金（规模约8.5亿美元）。
据悉，两只基金除了继续专注于SaaS和金融科技等领域外，还将进一步扩大投资范围，包括Web3等领域。红杉印度和东南亚此前已经投资CoinSwitch Kuber和Polygon等Web3初创公司。

摩根士丹利首席执行官James Gorman周一在纽约的金融会议上表示，随着美联储与通胀作斗争，经济衰退的可能性为50%，这高于他早些时候30%的预估。“我们现阶段不太可能陷入深度或长期衰退，我不认为未来几年我们会陷入巨大的困境，我认为美联储最终会控制住通胀。你知道这会很坎坷；人们的401(k)计划今年将会减少。”James Gorman认为，尽管市场一直在崩盘，但包括消费者和企业资产负债表在内的经济基本面状况比市场所暗示的要好。不过Gorman表示，美联储加息等待的时间太长，如果经济衰退开始，美联储的回旋余地就会变小。

没事来我们电报群吧，这里帅哥，美女多，代码也多，话题也多，机会多多，还可以防失联。（电报群搜索：橙子的朋友们）

【比特币行情分析】  比特币正在承受着市场去杠杆路上的疯狂抛售，当前没有明显的信号表明已经见底，哪怕是阶段性底的信号都没有出现，不过有一点是肯定的，等到市场消化了这次抛售之后，一定会大幅反弹，然后会继续调整，下半年的走势如果按照此前预期是比较乐观的，但是美联储那边通胀未解决，持续的加息会给市场带来很大的不确定性，所以大家要做好足够的准备来应对下半年不确定性的风险，这一点我在年初的时候也明确说过。

比特币基本上回到了前高19800附近了，也就是说这两年市场白玩了，怎么上去就怎么下来了，水分挤的干干净净，可能还没挤干净，加密市场市值从3万多亿美金跌破1万亿美金，回调的很彻底，我相信这个时候很多同学又开始怀疑区块链，牛市信仰爆棚，熊市信仰崩塌，然后再也不相信区块链，不相信加密货币了哈，其实这样没必要哦，炒币还是跟信仰不挂钩的好，然后你只要信趋势或者看懂趋势，我觉得你就会一直在这个行业耕耘，不会因为价格跌了就失去信心，越是这个时候，就要越勇敢点，好好生活，好好学习，持续迭代，只有这样你才能不被市场淘汰，然后下个牛市的时候赚钱笑嘻嘻。

【风险提醒】 数字资产波动较大，风险极高，请谨慎参与，杜绝满仓梭哈，拒绝贷款杠杆；

title: Zodium: Play, Earn, and Be Yourself with Soul Zodiac
body:
** 
 Author:** **@BitMetis** **| BitReport**

Your Source of Reliable, Unbiased Research and Due Diligence

> **BitMetis Review：**
>
> **Gameplay: Normal mechanism, Interesting narrative, All-in-One mode**
>
> **Tokenomics: Multi-token mechanism; Unreasonable token allocation**
>
> **NFT: General NFT market performance; Unlimited NFT collection**
>
> **Community: Average community size; Low engagement on Twitter but active relatively on Discord**
>
> **Investor & Team: Well-trained development team with expertise and operational capabilities; Strong-background investors**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xzEKLBq9WDlJOkwKs8857.png?height=445&width=901)

## Basic Information 

### Introduction 

Backed by Binance Smart Chain, Zodium is a ''Play to Earn'' project based on the animated 3D character NFT. The ancient oriental legends of the 12 zodiac animals and the 12 star signs are the fundamental concepts of Zodium. In the universe of Zodium, anyone can contribute to the ecosystem and acquire its tokens by collecting zodiac characters and playing games.

Zodium intends to support chain-swap between multi main-nets: BNB chain (BEP20), Matic (Polygon), IOST, and Immutable X.

### Gameplay

Generally, Zodium is a collectible card game. Players need to draw the Zodiac card packs, put a date of Birth to discover their Soul Zodiac, and open their own Zodiac Pack. Then,  if players don’t want to sell them,  the cards also can be upgraded to get more rare cards. What Zodium wants to achieve ultimately is that, with just one NFT, players will be able to access and enjoy numerous play-to-earn games ranging from mini-games to RPG games.

## Tokenomics 

Zodium Token There are three types of Token in Zodium: ZODI, CHARIS, and AQUA.

**- $ZODI**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/je1K9OI3HkqnZB0EmJ9Or.png?height=457&width=1308)

ZODI is the core token and general utility token on the Zodium platform, serving as a governance token of Zodium and it is used for all decisions related to project development. The more ZODI you hold, the higher status you are in the game with more permissions.

**IDO Information**

Some key dates are as follows:

* Total Supply: 888,888,888
* Public sale: 2,500,000 sold in IDO at $0.08, 100% TGE unlock
* Total unlock ratio at TGE: 0.28%
* ROI on Coinmarketcap:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/awdDHJ0wbLcuMFmjaPvni.png?height=202&width=867)

**ZODI Allocation**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Y2tuhWo8-RHV1JZjtH6ht.png?height=1320&width=1980)

**-$CHARIS**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/P35m9sJ_swlBKaszzwB33.png?height=490&width=1324)

CHARIS is Zodium's game utility token. Users can earn CHARIS as a reward for winning battles and use CHARIS for various activities in the game, such as crafting weapons. (Crafting weapons means minting weapons.) CHARIS is designed to promote the economic growth of the game. CHARIS is a fair-launch token that can only be minted upon the rewarding winning battle and will be burned when used.

**-$AQUA**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Otht4itLKJmrToOt6N86n.png?height=502&width=1303)

Aqua is the greatest resource on Trunico. Aqua will be utilized in measuring the strengths of the Guilds as it can be used to boost the power of the guild. The 12 KINDs Guild will compete for Aqua on Trunico, and hence, the season-winning Guild shall have the most Aqua.

## NFT Introduction 

At present, there are two collections of main NFTs in Zodium: 12 KINDs, and Weapons.  The 12 KINDs NFT was traded last year. Recently, the Weapons have also been available for trading.

**-12 KINDs**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KZ0QTdys96555OoXQKCeO.jpg?height=300&width=1980)

When ZERO came to Trunico and met each of the 12 zodiac animals, the soul of the 12 KINDs woke up, gained vitality, and became a creature. 12 KINDs are divided into five tiers: Common, Rare, Legendary, Soul Zodiac, and Untouchable. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7Bd3DbaaKxqO74QTYxYfT.png?height=354&width=934)

Zodium launched the 12 KINDs NFTs on December 8, 2021 on their official website. The supply of 12 KINDs is unlimited. Players can acquire 12 KINDs by drawing them on the Zodium website at a price of 100 $ZODI for one card pack containing three characters. By drawing cards, players can get any tier of cards except untouchable ones, which can only be obtained through special events.

Considering that the cost of a player's initial acquisition of a 12 KINDs NFT fluctuates with the price of the $ZODI, the lowest token price since the release of the 12 KINDs was chosen as a reference to analysis. With the lowest token price at $0.019 on June 4, 2022 , initially acquiring a 12 KINDs NFT costs $0.63, while the current floor price for NFTs is $0.7 (On June 8). In addition, there are a total of 1245 NFT items, and 1781 holders, while the total transaction volume has reached $135, 236.63 as of June 8.

**-Weapons**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jt8vpqP6pU2TYIDllC187.png?height=321&width=922)

To amplify the uniqueness of 12KINDs, there will be 12 different types of weapons for each animal. Weapons NFT plays an essential role in the game, with the addition of a level-up and upgrade system.

Weapons NFT opened for drawing on  May 9th this year. The market supply of Weapons is limited according to the Zodium project, but the specific figure still remains unknown. One Weapons NFT costs 100 $ZODI to draw. Similar to 12 KINDs, the lowest token price was chosen as a reference to analysis. With the lowest token price at $0.019 on June 4, 2022, initially acquiring a Weapons NFT costs $1.9，while the current floor price for Weapon NFTs is $4.66 (On June 8). However, it is worth noting that the trading figures of Weapons so far are very low. There are only 8 players and 5 items with the total transaction volume of $5.83.

## Community

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/y5YQQ0bDLFLTKrkNJHCVz.png?height=223&width=948)

The main fronts of this gaming community are Twitter and Discord. The number of Twitter followers is 47K. Discord has 24860 members. While Twitter has more followers than Discord, the engagement of Twitter seems not impressive. The average interaction data of daily posts keeps at 3/10/20(comments/retweets/likes) in recent weeks. Additionally, less than 5 whales are following Zodium on Twitter. 

In contrast, followers in Discord have much enthusiasm for the Game and NFT topics. Around 1500 members are often online. And more reactions from Discord for the announcements about the game as well. There are around 150 new messages in their general chat channel.

## 5 Investors & Team

### Team

Zodium was mainly created by the former co-founder of **LINE FRIENDs** and its members， which owns a series of super-popular animated characters including Brown and Cony. In general, the team consists of world-class storytellers, designers, programmers, business and blockchain developers, who have superb capability and profound experience in creating characters. 

### Partners 

**Animoca Brands**, known for its massive investments in the blockchain industry,  gained the status of the second-largest share and token holder of Zodium. In addition, some strong-background companies like Morningstar Ventures, ROK Capital, HG Ventures, etc. have funded the project. Zodium has raised $3.5M from top-tier investors such as Polygon, Morningstar Ventures, AU21, IOST, and Bybit.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LgJSCln20iwTnjrHu_bqu.png?height=558&width=721)

title: WEB3---三大最火体育项目
body:
一、篮球-NBA TOPSHOT（官网地址：[https://nbatopshot.com/](https://nbatopshot.com/api/referrals/google-oauth2%7C107848715895732643108)）

来自Flow生态的TOPSHOT可谓是开创了web3体育项目的开山鼻祖，和世界体育顶流联盟NBA强强联手，项目一推出就轰动了整个加密世界，可谓是当红炸子鸡。

![JAMES NFT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Pyx5aWEgqWIJAtOs2INCJ.png?height=637&width=640)

当时一张詹姆斯的传奇卡以20.8万美元（合约134.5万人民币）售出，这张动态球星卡取材自2019年11月湖人对阵国王的比赛，以詹姆斯扣篮短视频及图文为主体，隶属于NBA Top Shot的传奇系列，编号29，起价230美元，除此之外10万美元+的交易纪录也有多笔。

伴随着一笔笔巨额交易，NBA TopShot火出圈，在NBA众多球星投资人的带动下，大批球迷、收藏爱好者及投资者入场，同时也间接性的加速NFT市场的发展。

这个项目其实对于传统球星卡爱好者来说很容易理解，可以简单的理解为传统球星卡电子化，不同点在于每张卡都是独一无二的也就是非同质化，目前项目球员卡一共分为Common（普通）、Fandom（神话）、Rare（稀有）和Legendary（传奇）、Ultimate（终极）五个级别，

每个级别都有不同系列的卡，比如：新秀卡、季后赛卡、全明星卡等等。每个系列又有不同编号的卡，假如詹姆斯新秀系列有4000张，那么就有4000个编号，这也就是上述所说的每张卡都独一无二，目前市场上编号越靠前的卡越贵。

NBA TopShot除了用来收藏和市场交易之外，最近项目方还结合现实NBA比赛推出了挑战活动，玩家可根据实况比赛来推测挑战结果，并将对应的卡片放置在挑战区域，如果最终挑战成功将获得球星卡奖励。

目前项目较前期来说，随着卡发行量越来越大，市场整体也比较低迷，卡片价格一降再降，对于nba球迷来说现在是个入场的好时机，球星卡不贵可以买几张自己喜欢的收藏。

二、足球-sorare（官网地址：[sorare.com](http://sorare.com/r/kopgt)）

相信很多喜欢足球迷都听过或玩过梦幻足球联赛，没错就是sorare就是目前web3领域最火的梦幻足球游戏。创立于2018年的《Sorare》是一款梦幻足球游戏，玩家在游戏中买卖以真实足球运动员为主题的卡片。 每张卡都在以太坊区块链上注册为NFT，同样也是独一无二的。

![Sorare](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vD3ML71FgwKLcCI94munA.jpg?height=675&width=1200)

sorare去年被软银投了一笔6.8亿美元巨额融资，这笔融资也创造了法国A轮融资记录。足以见得这个项目有多火爆，软银也是看中了sorare的模式以及和web3的契合度。目前已经有多个联赛及豪门球队和sorare签约，包括拜仁、利物浦、尤文图斯、皇家马德里、巴黎圣日耳曼等。

和其他梦幻足球联赛一样，sorare的各种玩法也是基于现实足球数据，目前游戏类一共有四种等级的球星卡：limited、rare、superrare、unique四个等级，分别对应卡片数量为：1000、100、10、1，之前有一张unique版本的C罗卖到了24.5万欧元。游戏内支持ETH和信用卡两种支付方式，随着ETH的水涨船高，游戏内卡片普遍都得到了几倍或几十倍的涨幅。

sorare适应的玩家是铁杆球迷或市场投资客，前者是需要你对各大联赛各个球员有足够的了解，包括球队主力、球员球场内外状态、因为上场率是这个游戏最重要的指标，只有上场的球员才能获得分数，从而决定你最后的一个排名情况。如果你不了解足球，你也可以去市场上低买高卖，获得一些投资回报。

今年是世界杯年，相信随着世界第一体育赛事的到来，sorare会迎来一波新的涨幅，目前该游戏日活已经30万玩家左右，处于游戏前期状态，如果你对web3足球游戏感兴趣，sorare是个不错的选择。

三、跑步-Stepn（官方地址：<https://www.stepn.com/>）

要说目前最火的gamefi项目乃至最火的web3项目非“Stepn”莫属，这个项目上线仅半年时间就收获了几百万玩家入场，上面两个项目不同点在于，Stepn是建立在solana主链上的一款游戏。玩法也很简单，用户只需在户外散步、慢跑或跑步就可以“赚取可观的收入”。这里的可观在2022年第二季度确实很可观，很多早期入场的玩家赚的盆满钵满。

![Stepn](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6tPYdS-DUUwwBX-4n5NCt.jpg?height=614&width=1024)

tepnsTEPN和大多数gamefi项目相同，Stepn也采用了双币经济模型，玩家需要用solana购买球鞋，项目也照顾所有玩家，无论你是散步，慢跑还是快跑都可以找到属于自己的鞋型。在买完鞋之后就可以去运动了，玩家的收益来源于GST，而GST又可以用于升级球鞋等级。除此之外还有代币GMT，这个代币同样也适用于球鞋升级和繁衍下一代球鞋，玩家可以在市场出售自己的球鞋，因此除了运动可以赚钱，做球鞋贩子也是可以赚取利益。

项目在4月份的时候，GST一度涨到8U，很多玩家一天的收益高达几千U，那段时间也是很多新玩家疯狂入场，在持续了一段时间的火爆之后，很多人开始担心项目是否会崩盘。毕竟从过往的gamefi项目来看，当所有人都赚钱的时候基本就面临崩盘了。

在5月底的一个深夜，官方出了一则通告“开始清退中国大陆用户，将在7月对中国大陆玩家停止提供GPS及IP位置服务”，这也就意味着中国玩家在7月之后无法通过Stepn获取收益，虽然官方宣传中国大陆玩家只占总玩家的5%，但明显这不是真实数据，因为就在这则通过发出的半个月后，GST出现了暴跌，目前已经跌破0.5了，这意味着后面入场的玩家基本无法回本了。

总的来说Stepn项目还是一个很不错的web3项目，在luna爆雷那段时间，所有项目都在跌的情况下，只有Stepn不跌反涨，很多人都对该项目充满了信心。大家每天在社交媒体上跑步打卡，晒出自己的收益图，虽然官方最近一直更新游戏规则，但仍挡不住币价下跌的趋势，Stepn是就这样凉凉了还是会再次迎来春天，让我们拭目以待吧！

title: 不是Web2产品的替代，也不是Social to Earn：Web3社交的机会究竟在哪？
body:
## 核心观点

## 一、Web3社交概览

### 1.1 相关概念：Web3社交、SocialFi、去中心化社交

**Web3社交，可以说是所有具备与社交相关的Web3产品总称**，是一个很宽泛、但也比较容易理解的概念。就Web3而言，这些产品运行在公链上，在数据存储和运营管理上比Web2社交产品更强的去中心化特征，也往往会发行代币或者NFT；就“社交”而言，所有具备社交特征的场景都可以算在内，因此不少创作者经济相关的产品也在这个范畴内。值得注意的是，有些可能并不直接面向用户的协议类产品，一般也处于Web3的讨论范围。

SocialFi，也许是近两年被提及比“Web3社交”更多的一个概念。从起源上来讲，SocialFi这个词的传播和DeFi、GameFi的火爆有关，它在一开始出现的时候，更多侧重于描述那些社交金融化特征明显、侧重代币机制设计的项目。**不过随着时间的推移，现在SocialFi一词也被泛化使用，广义上也可以指代几乎所有的Web3社交项目 —— 毕竟，Web3社交项目的用户数据、用户关系都沉淀在链上，再加上代币机制设计有更多的发挥空间，先天在金融化上面具备优势**。

在更早的时候，也有过对“去中心化社交”“区块链社交”的讨论与尝试，不过随着“Web3社交”这一含义更全面的概念的出现，这些词汇也很少被人提及了。

### 1.2 赛道发展现状：多次成为热点，但依然缺乏头部明星项目

**Web3社交，整体来看，是一个依然处于萌芽期的赛道。相关项目层出不穷、星罗棋布，但直到2022年6月，这个赛道依然没有出现像Axie Infinity和StepN这样MAU最高超过百万的头部明星产品**。

> 如果有读者感觉某社交项目的热度可能可以与Axie Infinity、StepN比较，可以通过对MAU的估计、GoogleTrends搜索热度等方式，做一些观察验证。笔者目前是没有找到这样的Web3社交项目。

**然而，事实上每当加密货币市场出现牛市的时候，相关概念都会被人们提起和讨论一遍，也会涌现一些流行一时的热点项目**。但无论是上个周期的币乎、Steemit，还是这两年出现的Bitclout、Monaco，都只是昙花一现。这个事实，无疑非常值得深入探究其原因。

**也正是因为Web3社交赛道缺少明星项目、多数处于发展早期或者概念期，再加上本身“社交”含义的宽泛，导致各种各样的项目星罗棋布**。因此，相对于做一些项目盘点、尝试对该赛道做系统性的梳理，本文将更加聚焦于对一些关键议题的讨论：场景、代币机制与产品形态。

### 二、场景：Web3社交可能的机会在哪？

### 2.1 Web2社交的问题 & Web2社交替代的可能性

Web3社交，起源于人们对Web2社交的不满。Web2社交产品所存在的弊病也经常被人们所讨论，这里归纳总结如下：

1. 数据所有权问题：用户的数据、创作者的内容，被视为公司“数据资产、数据壁垒”的一部分；这是对用户本身权益的侵害，让用户面对公司的监管完全没有对抗能力。比如，微博、知乎、Twitter如果要封禁你的账号，你不仅会失去上面的创作内容和粉丝，更重要的是，很可能还申诉无门。这给用户带来了很大的不安全感。
2. 数据隐私问题：数据全部储存在公司的中心化数据库里面，由公司员工管理；这存在数据泄露风险，各种用户数据贩卖的事情也早已不是新闻。
3. 利益分配问题：创作者从用户这里得到的付费与打赏，平台方往往有一个较高的抽成比例；另外，平台主要依靠创作者内容流量变现的广告收入，但这些收入只有很少一部分流入了创作者。

诚然，上述问题都是客观存在的。**但更关键的是，这些Web2弊病的改善都没有指向用户直接的产品体验：数据的所有权、隐私问题是用户所担心的，利益分配问题也是创作者所关注的，但如果用户进入一个项目的产品，发现功能不齐全甚至还不新颖、人数寥寥（早期社交产品难免是这样），那么它的留存依然会是很大的问题**。**事实上，用户参与一个社交场景的具体使用体验，Web3的产品并没有做出相对于Web2实现的产品革命性的改进，这导致“Web3”本身并不能为社交类产品至关重要的早期增长和网络效应积累进行赋能**。再考虑到Web3对于Web2用户还有一层认知和入门操作上的壁垒，它的初期用户仅局限于Web3的活跃用户，这给它的启动无疑又增加了难度。

**从这个角度来看，简单的想在Web3世界里面做一个已有Web2成熟产品的场景，特别是如果这个产品已经被Web3用户所广泛使用，是非常难以成功的**。比如，在2021年上半年很火的，想做“Web3的Twitter”的Bitclout。毕竟，成熟社交产品具有极强的网络效应，不仅难以吸引新用户，而且即使吸引到了用户，一旦他们发现新的产品不能满足其现有的需求，那就会很快回到原来的成熟产品，再让他们回来将是难上加难。单靠Web3的新概念和对Web2现有问题的渲染宣传，最多只能成为吸引一部分Web3用户的引流手段，而不能成为产品走向成功的关键要素。事实上，所有做Web2已有产品替代、或者Web2已有场景的Web3社交项目，几乎无一例外都走向了失败。

> 其实，上述的分析不仅适用于Web3社交，也几乎适用于所有具备强网络效应的Web3应用层的赛道。不少读者曾经可能都有过疑惑：为什么Web3也发展一段时间了，但在应用层依然处于非常早期的阶段，很少有非金融相关的热门应用类产品？希望笔者的分析能够为大家解惑。

那么，既然已有成熟Web2产品的场景缺少机会，哪些场景可能存在Web3社交的机会呢？

按照关系链强弱和内容占比，社交场景可以大致分为：通信通讯类、交友匹配类、社交媒体、UGC社区类。四种场景的产品设计要点、交付给用户的价值是不一样的。

而前三类社交场景，都是网络效应极强、已有Web2成熟产品的。只有偏向于UGC社区类的场景，由于是新兴领域，且非常细分、碎片化倾向严重，Web2的触角还没有伸到每一个角落，存在Web3社交产品新兴的机会。

具体而言，笔者总结了以下方向，供大家参考：

**2.1 DAO/社群的社区聊天群组工具（Discord的替代品）**

Web3用户现在常用的社交媒体有哪些？Twitter、Telegram、Discord三巨头。在这里面，Discord的存在就很特别：它原来是一个供游戏玩家交流的聊天群组，在Web2中的渗透率和知名度远不如Twitter和Telegram；但随着疫情的爆发和Web3的兴起，其使用人数得到激增，Web3的兴趣团体也纷纷建立群组。在往后，这似乎变成了一种习惯，Web3的项目们在“前辈”们的习惯和没有更好用、更普及工具的现实之下，也都纷纷选择Discord作为自己的社群管理与交流的平台工具。

然而，这种普及并不代表着Discord本身就非常适用于Web3用户。Discord本身是一个典型的Web2产品，数据存储、管理审核都是中心化的；Discord的安全性事故频频发生，近期著名的时间有6月5日BAYC的Discord服务器就遭到攻击，导致价值200E的NFT被盗，其联合创始人Gordon Goner也发推文称“Discord不适用于Web3社區，我們需要一個更好的平台，将安全放在首位”。再者，Discord的产品体验，虽说已经做的不错，但针对Web3用户还是有不少改进空间的。

从社区聊天群组工具这个具体场景来看，相比于Twitter的短讯息社交网络、Telegram的群组即时通讯，Discord的用户粘性、网络效应也更加弱。毕竟，用户在上面是没有好友关系或者关注关系沉淀，更多是“跟着项目方/社区核心人员走”。如果这些人愿意迁移到新的平台，那么大多数用户也会跟着迁移。因此，做一个Web3原生的社区聊天群组工具，替代Discord现有的生态位，个人认为还是有一定可行性的，在一级市场上也有一些早期的项目。

**2.2 小而细分的兴趣社交场景**

既然在大的、成熟的场景做新的社交产品很难，那对于各种比较细分、没有很好既有Web2解决方案的新社交场景，Web3社交产品就可以做一些尝试。在这里面，如果这个场景本身就是Web3原生的，那自然再好不过；如果有Web2竞争对手，Web3社交产品就可以通过其特有的经济体系和对用户数据的尊重，在一开始的竞争、和更深度的用户体验上，和Web2同类产品起到区分。

* 做兴趣领域的粉丝经济，是一个可能有机会的方向。例如体娱粉丝激励平台Chiliz，主打体育产业里面的粉丝经济，$CHZ 是其代币。Socios目前与包括 AC 米兰、曼城、巴塞罗那等 48 个俱乐部或伙伴合作发行粉丝代币，其用户通过持有$CHZ，可购买俱乐的部粉丝代币。而持有粉丝代币可拥有社区投票权、决策权等权益。在该社区中，拥有粉丝代币的球迷可以对俱乐部的球衣颜色、体育场音乐和徽标等各种事宜进行投票，且投票结果具有约束力、强化了用户的社区参与。$CHZ目前流通市值超过5亿美元，在CoinMarketCap中排名65，算是Web3社交赛道中当前发展的还算不错的项目。
* 做Web3的“知识星球”，也是一个有可行性的方向，毕竟这也是一个网络效应相对较弱、用户跟着创作者走的场景，这个方向也可能会出现一些不错的项目，值得关注。例如Showme，就是一个建立在Web3上的NFT社交订阅平台，聚焦于Web3相关内容的分享订阅。创作者可以通过灵活的订阅方式吸引和积累粉丝，以便用户进入俱乐部，包括免费、付费、持有 NFT 和 Token 订阅。

值得一提的是，当下市场上还出现了围绕某个NFT系列持有者的社交项目：或是做一个现有值知名NFT持有者的“俱乐部”，比如Metalink；或是本身作为NFT的项目方，宣传其NFT作为社区限量版Pass的价值。对于这类项目，笔者的观点是：NFT作为社交入口，是一种“形式创新”，和具体的社交场景并无关系；要评价这类项目，还是要看其具体社区内的社交形态。

## 三、代币机制：社交场景不适合X2E；机制还有更多探索空间

随着SocialFi概念的兴起，代币在社交产品中所能起到的作用也被大家所讨论。面对社交产品早期的增长难题，有些人会想，为什么不把DeFi和GameFi中的挖矿、“To Earn”玩法引到社交领域呢？毕竟Axie、包括后来的StepN都是依靠这个方法破圈的。因此，我们也看到了不少主打“Social to Earn”“Create to Earn”，或者说是“社交挖矿”“内容挖矿”的项目。

然而，这些项目无一例外都走向了没落。究其原因，是因为社交场景并不适合作为“X to Earn”中的“X”场景：一方面，社交场景的评价体系依赖于其他用户的反馈，导致初期激励有限、反作弊机制设计也较为困难，容易导致经济体系不平衡；另一方面，即使起步成功，大量涌入的以“打金”为目的的用户也会损害社交产品本身的调性，一旦“to Earn”这部分收益锐减就会带来大量用户的流逝。Steemit、Monaco从喧嚣到落寞的过程，都佐证了这一点。（关于X to Earn场景的讨论，可以参考笔者之前写的文章：[X to Earn研究：X是根本，E是服务于X的增长范式](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?src=11&timestamp=1655174532&ver=3859&signature=TRBkodjpkpPqKvui7zybOhdDZo1ApvYdKw9s6e6HNmOvIP19nnC\*8ezVcL6ZQ38G44YZCm3G4goHUaUI\*bXtH-VO1kszNvKU\*ze3kvydBOXLXjNVZvqS7LxQIOa3JSS7&new=1)）

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ijh64w0KBCP607237TKxR.png?height=1868&width=3496)

那么，如果不考虑X to Earn，社交代币又有什么具体的用途呢？如上图所示，知名Web3研究机构Messari曾将社交代币分为三类：个人代币、社区代币、平台代币。然而，具体来看的话，我们可以发现这些价值依然是一些比较经典的Web3代币价值类型，比如Pass、治理权、分红权、潜在升值空间等。

其实我们可以发现，这些代币价值依然是一些比较经典的Web3代币价值。虽然它们确实能够在项目发展中起到一定积极作用，但就社交场景中特有的用户激励与利益分配而言，依然有很多的探索空间。目前，就Web3社区中对各种创新类的代币机制、经济模型的研究来看，相比于Defi、Gamefi，“SocialFi”在代币机制上有诸如Chiliz、Rally做出的创新，但还没有非常令人惊艳的设计。

## 四、产品形态：协议与应用之争

“胖协议，瘦应用”这一Web3理念，一直存在相关的争议与讨论，这在社交赛道中体现的尤为明显。下面让我们来具体看看关于应用层产品形态的问题。

### 4.1 Web3协议简介

什么是Web3社交中的“协议”呢？打个最直观的比方，就是手机通讯录：当你下载一个新的App的时候，一部分App会允许你“导入通讯录”，从而自动的在好友名单上获取通讯录中其它使用该App的好友；腾讯系App的“导入微信好友”也是相似的道理。它们某种程度上，都试图在把人们的社交关系给“协议化”，让一个希望引入社交相关功能的新产品，能够快速获取用户的社交关系并让用户上手，而不是再重新走一遍让用户加好友这一费时费力的行为。

遗憾的是，在Web2中，随着手机号作为社交象征的式微、各大平台的派系划分，上述功能的体验并不尽如人意。而在Web3中，由于Web3基于区块链的技术架构，协议层天然有着更好的发展空间 —— 既然一个“合格”Web3社交应用中，与用户相关的数据、关系都会沉淀在链上，那为什么不先把这部分提取出来做成一个协议，方便各种新的想做社交功能的应用产品来调用呢？

因此，“胖协议，瘦应用”这一理念，在社交赛道指的是这样的畅想：用户之间的社交关系、互动数据，都被协议们所提取、沉淀下来；而任何一个新的应用想要做社交功能的话，就可以调用这些协议，让用户能够“无缝继承”之前已有的社交历史。也就是说，用户可以毫无顾忌地退出一个平台或加入一个新的平台，而不用担心自己的朋友、粉丝、内容、价值无法带走。

目前而言，Web3协议层比较受关注的两大项目是CyberConnect和Lens Protocol，其Twitter粉丝数都超过了5万。它们在具体的技术实现机制上区别不小：Cyberconnect本身不是智能合约，内容储存在IPFS上，其对开发者和用户学习成本较高，但是没有Gas费用、内容也永久储存；Lens Protocol本质是基于Polygon的智能合约，希望构建以NFT为核心的社交关系图谱，它的可组合型更好、门槛更低，但是有Gas消耗和Layer2容量、url化的NFT内容储存问题。

除了CyberConnect和Lens Protocal以外，另外两个有一定关注度的社交协议是5Degrees和Mem Protocol，感兴趣的读者可以再做进一步研究。

### 4.2 应用与协议之争

从意识形态上来讲，“胖协议，瘦应用”肯定更加符合Web3社区去中心化、去平台化的理念。毕竟，谁都不希望每换一个应用都要重新整一遍加好友和关注 —— 如果真的是这样与Web2无异的体验，那也就失去Web3的意义了。

然而，从实际发展上来讲，协议本身又很难脱离应用而走向用户：这一点和DID有点类似，如果没有切身、实际的需求，愿意事先给自己打造一套身份、构建一套社交关系的用户，终归是少数。也就是说，社交协议想要真的成型，往往还需要有面向用户、有具体社交场景的产品的火爆来把它带火。

那么，鉴于协议层本身的价值和想象力，这个已经火起来的社交产品，为什么不自己把协议层也做了呢？毕竟不少协议代码是开源的，而它们目前沉淀的关系网络并没有太多价值。其实，协议项目方本身也意识到了这个问题，比如Lens Protocol也有往应用产品发展的趋势。应用会往协议走、协议会往应用走，这方面的竞争态势才刚刚展开，远没有达到成熟。甚至，就连本应属于Web3上游的DID，也遭到了波及 —— 有些社交项目在展望中，提到了构建DID的展望，而一些DID项目也不排除自己做Social场景的可能。

总而言之，虽然协议和应用在成熟的Web3中会是一个分离较为明显的事情，但在Web3发展的初期，它们的耦合可能会是相当严重的，竞争关系也是错综复杂的。笔者的个人认为，在初期如果出现火爆的社交产品，更考验团队对用户需求的理解能力、运营能力，这方面做应用产品起家的团队可能会更有优势；但长期来看，Web3社交中协议层的打造是一个必然的趋势，在这方面一些做协议出身的、有技术积累的团队可能会更有优势。

## 五、发展时机：一年内不乐观，长期坚定看好

最后，谈谈笔者个人对相关发展时机的预测，说实话，笔者对1年内该赛道的发展速度并不乐观。当下的加密货币市场环境是原因之一，但更主要的原因是，当前Web3社交潜在用户的基数，对社交产品而言并不算多：

* 首先，对Web2用户而言，进入Web3有一道天然较高的门槛；再加上社交赛道难以应用X 2E模式在初期快速破圈。事实上，Web3社交产品在初期发展的时候基本上都会瞄准现有Web3的用户；
* 然而，Web3社交的潜在用户并没有部分人想象的那么多：虽然A16Z估计的Web3用户已有3000-5000万，Metamask的MAU也大致是这个量级但考虑到一人多地址的现象和那些“浅尝辄止”的用户，真实可能会成为Web3产品潜在用户的数量，估计最多1000万左右（注意，V神Twitter关注数约400万，赵长鹏也不过640万；考虑到Twitter在Web3用户中的普及率，这两位风格迥异的Web3 KOL，很难想象一个Web3社交活跃用户不会关注这两位中的至少一个）
* 所以，如果把Web3社交看做一个当下全球潜在用户只有小千万量级的大场景，相关产品起步的困难也就不令人意外了。毕竟，从大场景的潜在用户，转化为具体场景的潜在用户，中间还要过好几个转化漏斗，社交产品尤其如此。如果一开始的潜在用户基数都不够的话，起步阶段对项目方就是一个严峻的考验。

因此，Web3社交产品的成功，离不开Web3用户基数的增多，而这需要众多Web3产品做不断的努力，绝非一日之功。

长期来看，随着Web3的发展，会涌现众多新的社交场景，Web2社交产品的弊病在对比之下也会越来越明显；当Web3开始成熟的时候，相信类似于“微信”超维打击“短信”的故事，也会发生在Web3新社交明星产品对现有Web2产品的替代上。
